item.title: Beogram 4002 (5513): Restoration of Worn Keypad
item.description:
I’m currently working on restoring a Beogram 4002 (5513) turntable and have reached the stage of addressing cosmetic details. A common issue with this model, as with approximately 90% of them, is a worn keypad. The original coating deteriorates over time due to exposure to skin oils and acids. This results in unsightly smudges, especially on units that have seen regular use. I recently acquired some refurbished keypads from a contact in Denmark to have on hand for my restoration projects...
Read The Full Article :https://Nexus-Security.github.io/beogram-4002-5513-restoration-of-worn-keypad/

item.title: Beogram 4002 (5513): Keypad Restoration and LEDs for the RPM Indicators
item.description:
The Beogram 4002 (5513) I’m currently working on had a significantly deteriorated keypad. The material used for these keypads tends to wear down over time due to the oils from fingerprints, making them a known weak point in this model. My friend in Denmark, who sadly passed away recently, was an expert at restoring these keypads. In his memory, I’ve been trying to learn his techniques. A couple of months ago, I started practicing, and I managed to successfully restore one keypad...
Read The Full Article :https://Nexus-Security.github.io/beogram-4002-5513-keypad-restoration-and-leds-for-the-rpm-indicators/

item.title: Beogram 4002: Awesome Refurbished Keypads in the House!
item.description:
I received two refurbished Beogram 4002 keypads from Denmark today. My friend, who did the repainting, said the weather conditions were perfect for the job, and he was right! The picture shows how fantastic they look. He’s incredibly talented! The keypads look brand new, as if they were just made in 1975. He did a phenomenal job. I had sent him a worn-out keypad from a Beogram 4002 I recently restored, and he even found another one!..
Read The Full Article :https://Nexus-Security.github.io/beogram-4002-awesome-refurbished-keypads-in-the-house-/

item.title: Beogram 4002 (5501): Worn Keypad Restoration - My Process Finally Appears Reproducible...
item.description:
The Beogram 4002 (5501) I’m currently restoring had a common issue: a worn-out keypad. The start button, in particular, was in rough shape due to frequent use. After a multi-month endeavor, I successfully restored the keypad to an almost-new appearance. My refined restoration method finally produces consistent results, marking a significant step forward in the 4002’s rehabilitation. During the process, I discovered another problem: a broken RPM panel clamp. This prevented the RPM panel from staying securely in place...
Read The Full Article :https://Nexus-Security.github.io/beogram-4002-5501-worn-keypad-restoration-my-process-finally-appears-reproducible/

item.title: Beogram 4002: Restoration of a Keypad with a Worn Through Start Button
item.description:
A Beogram 4002 keypad, showing signs of wear, was recently sent from New Zealand. The start button’s coating was entirely worn down: This is a common problem for Beogram keypads. The combination of skin acids and friction wears away the coating. Fortunately, this is fixable. Here is the keypad after being restored: It looks great! The coating will be left to harden further before being returned to New Zealand...
Read The Full Article :https://Nexus-Security.github.io/beogram-4002-restoration-of-a-keypad-with-a-worn-through-start-button/
